intro: Laurentia michelii var. bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored laurentia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its striking bi-colored flowers, which typically display a mix of white and purple hues. The plant belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. Its leaves are opposite and often have a velvety texture, adding to its visual appeal. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for tropical and subtropical landscapes.
